The Ambergeddon was a little better. I would like it if they had a better selection of darks. They only make a few and none were available during our visits.  We swung by on the way back to the airport, and were able to get a couple of the Korean shrimp lettuce wraps and a chicken sandwich. Not sure what made the wraps Korean, but they were tasty. So was the sandwich. I appreciate that they have tasty food that is reasonably priced--an unusual combination at breweries. Great service here. This time we were on a time crunch and they went out of their way to accommodate.

My friends and will go here again for sure.  The food was very tasty and the service was pretty good.  Not a very large menu, but enough for everyone to find something.  I was a little turned off by all of the upcharges for what one would think would be included (example, it was $1.50 more charge to have the wrap versus a huge salad)  Definitely a place to take your friends!

Good beer, so i am told by my boyfriend, as I don't drink beer, but he loves their beer, especially Diablo!  I think they make an excellent old fashioned.   We eat here quite a bit and I have always enjoyed their food.  We just discovered their fish fry and have went the last 3 weeks for it!  It's really good!  Not greasy at all, lightly breaded, and very tasty.  They just switched out from having a great potato casserole side dish.  Now they have french fries!  Both were excellent!  The fries had the dry rub on them, which is the same as is put on their wings.  Wings are also good! I recommend coming here!  We like to eat outside when it's nice out and do like the patio here.   Friendly servers too.  Nice to have in our neighborhood.

Went here for a lunch date with my wife one day. Sampled a few pints of their beers. The beers that we tried were all great. The staff were very nice and did a really good job of explaining the different brews that they offered.   As for our lunch it was bit of a miss. For an appetizer we ordered the chips and salsa and guac sauce. I went with the Citrus Salmon salad and my wife ordered the Hot Turkey and muenster. The chips all tasted like they were burnt from over cooking and the guacamole tomatillo salsa that they served was not good at all. As far as my entree is concerned the salmon had no flavor to it and the citrus spinach salad it was on was just as flavorless. My wife enjoyed her sandwich but stated that it was nothing special.   All in all the beer was quite enjoyable, the food not so much.   I would definitely try them again but would steer away from those menu items.

We found the beer to be average- nothing really standing out from the crowd but certainly not horrible. The food, however, WAS horrible. OG flatbread "pepperoni, fresh basil, truffle oil" was flavorless, lacking fresh basil (see pic) and drowning in bland sauce. With so many other breweries in the area, we wouldn't come back.

If I were rating their beers alone, I'd probably give them a 5-star rating, but their new facility in tandem with their tendency to inundate their line-up with hoppy beers drops them to a 4-star rating.  The new brewing facility is located outside of town, making it slightly unaccessible and it has a vulgar, suburban novelty to it.  The food is equally suburban.  The increased footprint means that they have room to expand, which I am happy about because their beers are generally right on the mark.

I went with a flight of non-IPA drafts. Sure, some may say that I missed out on some good beers, but I would say that Ale Asylum has some pretty solid non-IPAs.  I totally suggest a flight when you are trying a brewery for the first time. Why not sample all the beers?   I think they have a good location, just have your Uber swing by to grab a beer before you fly out of Madison. It's brilliant. The grunge vibe is warming and great for just hanging with your friends. I dig it.

I've been meaning to get over to the new brewery and the recent snow storm afforded me the perfect opportunity. Why? Because my S.U. was flying into Madison and was stuck getting de-iced on the runway in Chicago. I figured, hang at the Ale Asylum brewery, bring my laptop because they have WIFI (the airport doesn't) and wait it out with a pint of Hopalicious.  What a spot! Open and airy, nice wood. Several different areas. You could get lost in this place. I had heard that I shouldn't expect much of the food but I had a more than decent pulled pork sandwich and a fresh pint of Hopalicious. They have a wall behind the bar with sign for each beer that they brew. If it's lit up, they have it.  The place was pretty quiet  for a Thursday night, there was a snow storm after all. I was told that it's usually packed on Thirsty Thursday. While I considered having a second pint, I didn't. Not because a second flight would have caused me to drive too slowly and swerve around on the road, the snow and road conditions made everyone drive like they'd had a few too many, but I saw on the flight tracker that the S.U. was in the air and due in 15 minutes.  A great space and an awesome place to wait for the call that says, "We just landed, meet you out front".
